column4: Hello guys! I'm about to be a new Ubuntu user; I'm moving over from Gentoo, just burning the install now. =]
Awesome :)
I would suggest to install from the Alternate cd and build from there.
Aye, the alternate CD differs in which way?
It's a text-based installer.. and since you're coming from gentoo, I would think you can handle it
Oh, awesome. =). Although I've never install Ubuntu before, so does that text installer have instructions?
The desktop cd is a livecd with a gui installer, but I have never used it
It's quite easy to understand.. I know an 8 year old who used it and didn't have any questions until the partitioning section :)
I use only those and they have tons of stuff in them
Alright awesome! I'm looking specifically for the nvidia beta drivers, and beryl
Will that alternate CD allow me to customize my partitioning scheme?
Yes, I use it to setup my own parition scheme before installiung
I have a feeling you're going to like the alternate cd
And what is Ubuntu's default? I, personally use XFS. Does Ubuntu have any need for certain folders to be mounted on seperate paritions? (as /usr/portage/) in gentoo
No idea about that, I just always use ext3 and the only custom thing I do is have /home on /dev/hdb1
Alrighty, thank you. =)
Some good URL's for you: http://ubuntuforums.org/ , https://wiki.ubuntu.com/
Alright, I have my crappy laptop on next to me, I'm going to join this channel from there so I can ask for guidance if need be
Good idea
crappy laptop? you mean a craptop?
Precisely! P2 400mhz, meh get's the job done
